alert.note: Alert for Denver (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 12:34PM MDT until May 11 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Along Cherry Creek, Willow creek and Big Dry Creek, including the following counties, Arapahoe and Denver. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas especially near and along the creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1229 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. Rapid rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Denver, southwestern Aurora, Centennial, eastern Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Sheridan, Cherry Hills Village, Foxfield and down stream of Cherry Creek Reservoir.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
